org.svvrl.goal.core.io
Interface Codec

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractAltAutomatonCodec, AbstractImageCodec, ACTLCodec, AltAutomatonCodec, AntichainCodec, AutomatonCodec, BACodec, DotCodec, FSACodec, GameCodec, GasTeXCodec, GFFCodec, GFFCollectionCodec, JFFCodec, JFFNFWCodec, JPEGCodec, LBTTCodec, LogicCodec, LTL2BuchiCodec, MoDeLLaCodec, MXCodec, OldAltAutomatonCodec, OldAutomatonCodec, OldFSACodec, OldGameCodec, OldGFFCodec, ORECodec, PGSolverCodec, PNGCodec, PromelaCodec, QPTLCodec, RECodec, SVGCodec, TikzCodec, TwoWayAltAutomatonCodec, VaucansonCodec, XMLCodec
public interface Codec

Codec provides an interface for codecs that can encode an editable object as a file and decode the file back to the editable object.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

Method Summary
 boolean canDecode()
          Return true if this codec can do decoding.
 boolean canEncode(Editable obj)
          Returns true if this codec can encode a specified object.
 Editable decode(java.io.InputStream in)
          Decodes an object from an input stream.
 void encode(Editable obj, java.io.OutputStream out)
          Encodes an object.
 java.lang.String getDescription()
          Returns the short description of this codec.
 java.lang.String getName()
          Returns the name of the codec.
 java.lang.String getSuffix()
          Returns the file extension.
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the codec.

Returns:
the name of the codec

getSuffix

java.lang.String getSuffix()
Returns the file extension. It will be used when encoding an object as a file by this codec.

Returns:
a file extension starting with a "."

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns the short description of this codec. The description will appear in the file dialog.

Returns:
the description of this codec

canEncode

boolean canEncode(Editable obj)
Returns true if this codec can encode a specified object.

Parameters:
obj - the object to be encoded
Returns:
true if this codec can encode obj

canDecode

boolean canDecode()
Return true if this codec can do decoding.

Returns:
true if this codec can do decoding

encode

void encode(Editable obj,
            java.io.OutputStream out)
            throws CodecException
Encodes an object.

Parameters:
obj - the object to be encoded
out - the output channel for the encoded data
Throws:
CodecException - if there is an error in encoding obj

decode

Editable decode(java.io.InputStream in)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       CodecException
Decodes an object from an input stream.

Parameters:
in - an input stream holding the encoded data
Returns:
the object represented by the encoded data in in
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in getting data from in
CodecException - if there is an error in decoding the data in in
